title: Broken access control — admin section accessible without admin privileges
vulnerability_information:
## Summary
The Juice Shop administration panel is accessible by navigating directly to the admin path. The application only hides the admin link from the UI for non-admin users but does not enforce server-side access controls on the admin routes.

## Steps to Reproduce
1. Log in as any regular user at http://localhost:3333/#/login
2. Navigate directly to the administration panel:
```
http://localhost:3333/#/administration
```
3. The administration page loads and displays:
   - All registered user accounts with emails
   - All customer feedback/reviews
   - Ability to delete reviews
   - User recycle requests

## Alternative PoC — via API
1. With any valid authentication token, send:
```
GET http://localhost:3333/api/Users
Authorization: Bearer <regular_user_token>
```
2. All user data is returned including admin accounts

## Impact
Critical — Any authenticated user can access the full administration panel, view all user data, and perform administrative actions like deleting feedback. This is a complete bypass of the authorization model.

## Expected Behavior
The administration routes and API endpoints should verify that the authenticated user has admin role before granting access.

## Actual Behavior
Authorization checks are only performed client-side (UI element visibility). Server-side endpoints serve admin data to any authenticated user.
